ticket.title: Routing cutover: ProtocolServer dispatchers on operator/session sockets

in_scope: Route operator.sock and session.sock through tag-based ProtocolServer dispatchers.
Remove JSON IpcRequest parsing from default socket handler.
Reject JSON downgrade attempts by default (fail-closed).
If any legacy path remains, gate it behind explicit dev-only flag and separate socket.
out_of_scope: Extending legacy JSON handlers as a primary solution path.

steps: Delete JSON parsing from default socket handler.
Add adversarial test for JSON downgrade rejection.

criteria: Tag-based protocol frames succeed on operator.sock and session.sock.
JSON IpcRequest frames are rejected before handlers::dispatch.
Legacy JSON IPC is disabled by default or gated behind explicit dev-only flag.

notes.security:
DD-009 hard cutover: protocol dispatchers must be reachable; JSON IPC is a
downgrade/bypass surface and must be fail-closed by default.
notes.general:
This is the prerequisite routing cutover required before any HEF/FAC v0
work can be exercised via operator.sock/session.sock.
